message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CE, cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.SI. 

The paper proposes a personalized real-time risk scoring algorithm that uses machine learning techniques to analyze electronic health record data and predict the clinical acuity of ward patients. This involves learning patient subtypes and modeling physiological data streams associated with each subtype using a mixture of Gaussian Process experts. The paper also discusses the use of transfer learning techniques to learn the relationship between a patient's latent subtype and her static admission information. Based on this, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction), and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
